verses.text: 祭司違命背約祭司啊！現在這命令是給你們的。

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to violate a command'.
A verb-object compound meaning 'to betray a covenant'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「你們若不聽從，若不放在心上，不把榮耀歸給我的名，我就使咒詛臨到你們中間，我要咒詛你們應得的福分，並且已經咒詛了，因為你們沒有把這命令放在心上。

words.note: A divine title for God, meaning 'Yahweh of armies'.

verses.text: 我要斥責你們的子孫，也要把糞塗抹在你們的臉上，就是節期祭牲的糞；人要把你們抬到糞堆去。」
萬軍之耶和華說：「這樣，你們就知道是我把這命令給你們，使我與利未所立的約得以存留。

words.note: A divine title for God, meaning 'Yahweh of armies'.

verses.text: 我與他所立的是生命和平安的約，也把這些賜給了他。我要使他敬畏我，又畏懼我的名。

words.note: Implies a gift from a superior to an inferior.
Often used in religious contexts for reverence towards God.

verses.text: 在他的口中有真理的教訓，在他的嘴裡也沒有不義；他以平安和正直與我同行，使許多人回頭離開罪孽。」

words.note: Commonly used for 'peace' in biblical contexts.
More formal than '和'.
Lit. 'turn head'; often means spiritual repentance.

verses.text: 祭司的嘴當保存知識，人要從他的口中尋求教訓，因為他是萬軍耶和華的使者。

words.note: Functions as an auxiliary verb.
Auxiliary verb indicating desire or necessity.
Usually appears in 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「你們卻偏離了正路，使許多人在律法上跌倒；你們也破壞了我與利未所立的約。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive, similar to '的'.
Used with '在...上' to indicate scope or aspect.
Often used metaphorically for spiritual falling.
More formal than '和'.
Classical particle, indicates something is 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 因此，我也使你們在眾人面前被藐視、受輕看，因為你們不遵守我的道，在律法上徇人的情面。」

words.note: Indicates receiving an action, often negative.
Refers to God's ways or teachings.
Used with '在...上' to indicate scope or aspect.
Often found in '徇私' (show favoritism).
To '徇情面' means to show favoritism or partiality.

verses.text: 猶大人不忠不貞我們不是同有一位父嗎？不是同一位 神創造我們嗎？為甚麼我們各人對自己的兄弟不忠，褻瀆我們列祖的約呢？

words.note: Often implies spiritual or marital infidelity.
Used to form rhetorical questions.
Refers to God as Father in this context.
Used to form rhetorical questions.
Often capitalized in Chinese Bibles to refer to God.

verses.text: 猶大人行了詭詐，在以色列和耶路撒冷中作了可憎的事；因為猶大人褻瀆耶和華所愛的聖所，娶了事奉外族神的女子為妻。

words.note: Describes deceptive or treacherous behavior.
Used as a locative suffix with places.
Refers to something hateful or abhorrent to God.
Refers to treating something sacred with disrespect.
Forms a passive or nominalized structure with a verb.
Refers to a sacred dwelling place, e.g., the Temple.
Often used in religious contexts for serving deities.
Refers to non-Israelite people or nations.
Indicates 'to be' or 'to take as'.

verses.text: 行這事的，無論是主動的，或是附從的（「無論是主動的，或是附從的」直譯是「叫醒的、答應的」），連那獻禮物給萬軍耶和華的，耶和華必把那人從雅各的帳棚中除掉。

words.note: Transforms a verb phrase into a noun phrase (e.g., 'those who do').
Often part of the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍耶和華).
Used to prepose a direct object, often indicating its disposal.
Refers to a dwelling, particularly common in Old Testament.
Used as a locative suffix.

verses.text: 你們又行了這事：使眼淚、哀哭和呻吟蓋滿了耶和華的壇，因為耶和華不再垂看禮物，也不喜悅從你們手中收納。

words.note: Refers to expressions of deep sorrow or mourning.

words.definition: to look down upon, to regard
words.note: Often implies a favorable or attentive regard from a superior.

words.definition: to be pleased, to delight in

words.note: Used as a locative suffix (e.g., in your hands).
Implies accepting something offered, often sacrifices or tributes.

verses.text: 你們還問：「為甚麼呢？」因為耶和華在你和你年輕時所娶的妻子中間作證；她是你的伴侶，是你立約的妻子，你竟對她不忠！

words.note: Forms a passive or nominalized structure with a verb.
Refers to formal agreements or treaties, especially with God.
Expresses surprise or an unexpected turn of events.

verses.text: 神所作的不是一個嗎？其餘的氣息都是屬於他的。那一個尋求甚麼呢？就是 神的子孫。（本節原文意思不確定）

words.note: Forms a passive or nominalized structure with a verb.
In biblical contexts, often refers to life force or spirit.

verses.text: 耶和華以色列的 神說：「我恨惡休妻和以強暴待妻子。」萬軍之耶和華說：「所以要謹守你們的靈性，不可行詭詐的事。」

words.note: Often elevated in older texts to show reverence.
A verb-object compound meaning 'to divorce one's wife'.
Often part of the title 'Lord of Hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical equivalent of modern 的.

verses.text: 你們用自己的言語使耶和華厭煩，你們還說：「我們怎樣使他厭煩呢？」因為你們說：「作惡的，耶和華都看為善，並且喜悅他們。」或說：「公義的 神在哪裡呢？」

words.note: Here 'the ones who do evil'.
